title: Mystery deepens over death of England fan Rob Spray after family advised not to see his body
text:
The mystery surrounding the death of an England fan in Bulgaria has deepened after the family were advised not to see Rob Spray’s body and are now waiting for the results of tests to determine whether or not he suffered injuries.

Mr Spray’s body arrived back in England last week, but immediate family have been advised by an undertaker that the swelling to his head is so severe that visiting his body could be too traumatic.

That contradicts reports Mr Spray’s family were passed on from Bulgaria, when they were initially told his body was in no way harmed after he died in police custody ahead of England’s Euro 2020 qualifying game in Sofia.

A digital autopsy and a CT scan will now be carried out on Mr Spray’s body, following the recommendation of a coroner and the visit of a forensic team to the undertaker.

Mr Spray’s family hope that the autopsy and scan, together with a test on his bones and the results of a toxicology report from Bulgaria, will provide more answers over how he died and confirm that his death was not related to drugs.

The latest significant development has only further underlined the family’s desire for a full independent investigation into how Mr Spray died after being found in a helpless condition before being taken out of hospital and dying in transit.
description: The mystery surrounding the death of an England fan in Bulgaria has deepened after the family were advised not to see Rob Spray’s body and are now waiting for the results of tests to determine whether or not he suffered injuries.
